title: Chewy Coconut Bibingka (Filipino Rice Cake) Recipe
description: A very coconutty and chewy Flilipino rice flour dessert. Traditionally, this is baked in banana leaves.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Filipino Chewy Coconut Bibingka (Filipino Rice Cake) 4.4 (7) 6 Reviews 6 Photos A very coconutty and chewy rice flour dessert. Traditionally, this is baked in banana leaves, but my family prefers the crispy edges, which is why I use a sheet pan. I have been testing out several types of chewy desserts using rice flour, and this seems to be the favorite. Submitted by MattOlay V-H Updated on March 6, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 6 6 6 6 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 45 mins Additional Time: 20 mins Total Time: 1 hr 20 mins Servings: 24 Yield: 24 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 24 servings 1 (13.5 ounce) can coconut milk 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 stick butter, melted 4 eggs 2 (12 ounce) jars macapuno strings in heavy syrup 2 ½ cups sweet rice flour (mochiko) 1 cup packed brown sugar 1 tablespoon vanilla extract Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a 12x17-inch rimmed baking sheet. Beat condensed milk, coconut milk, and melted butter together in a large mixing bowl until combined. Add eggs, 1 at a time, and beat until combined. Add macapuno, 1 jar at a time, and beat until combined. Gradually beat in mochiko flour. Beat in brown sugar; beat in vanilla extract. Pour batter onto the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until top is golden brown and sides are slightly dark brown, 45 to 50 minutes. Allow to cool, about 20 minutes, before loosening the sides and cutting into squares. Recipe Tip For an optional topping, mix a 14-ounce can of sweetened condensed milk with an egg yolk. Spread topping on the cake 20 minutes before it's finished baking. Add Your Photo Photos of Chewy Coconut Bibingka (Filipino Rice Cake) 01 of 06 Photo by  Kim 02 of 06 Photo by  Kim 03/05/2024 I was really surprised by these--they are quite tasty, albeit a bit rich. I was super worried about them being too sweet; so I used just a scant 1/3 cup loosely packed brown sugar, drained a good 1 cup (at least) of the heavy syrup off the macapuno, and added 1 teaspoon of salt. With these changes, the bars were sweet, but not overly so. I also baked them in a 9x13" pan, and it baked up beautifully in 55 minutes. I cut them into about 32 pieces, since they are so rich, it's better to have smaller servings. Thank you for sharing your recipe! 03 of 06 Photo by  HokieinKC 02/06/2022 Perfect snack or dessert, as mentioned. I ate chewy rice flour and coconut confections as a child and this recipe fits the bill.Husband also developed a gluten sensitivity to this treat is a welcome addition to what he can enjoy.Instead of baking in a large pan, I halved the recipe and baked in three smaller square pans. Baked in half the time and enjoyed them sooner! 04 of 06 Photo by  Eileen Seibel 05/29/2020 05 of 06 Photo by  Rowena 01/01/2020 06 of 06 Photo by  MattOlay V-H 06/09/2013 1 You’ll Also Love Purple Yam and Coconut Mochi (Ube Bibingka) 1 Rating Maja Blanca Maiz (Corn Pudding) 7 Ratings Ube Halaya Ginataang Manok (Chicken Cooked in Coconut Milk) 48 Ratings Squash and Coconut Milk Stew 32 Ratings Maja Blanca (Coconut Pudding) 23 Ratings Instant Pot® Ginataang Salmon (Filipino Salmon in Coconut Milk) 11 Ratings Champorado 11 Ratings Steamed Vegan Rice Cakes (Banh Bo Hap) 1 Rating Karioka Sweet Rice Balls 6 Ratings Palitaw (Sweet Rice Cakes) 12 Ratings Chi Chi Dango 102 Ratings Filipino Rice (Arroz Valenciana) Low-Carb Coconut Lime Bars 27 Ratings Ginataang Alimasag (Crabs in Coconut Milk) 3 Ratings Gluten-Free Coconut Cake 57 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. Add macapuno, 1 jar at a time, and beat until combined. Gradually beat in mochiko flour. Beat in brown sugar; beat in vanilla extract. Pour batter onto the prepared baking sheet.;Bake in the preheated oven until top is golden brown and sides are slightly dark brown, 45 to 50 minutes.;Allow to cool, about 20 minutes, before loosening the sides and cutting into squares.
